commented_code:
To enable structured logging, set the property configprop:logging.structured.format.console[] (for console output) or configprop:logging.structured.format.file[] (for file output) to the id of the format you want to use.
 
+WARNING: xref:#features.logging.custom-log-configuration[Custom Log Configuration] take precedence over structured logging.

discussion_comments.commented_code:
@@ -450,6 +450,7 @@ Spring Boot supports structured logging and has support for the following JSON f
 
 To enable structured logging, set the property configprop:logging.structured.format.console[] (for console output) or configprop:logging.structured.format.file[] (for file output) to the id of the format you want to use.
 
+WARNING: xref:#features.logging.custom-log-configuration[Custom Log Configuration] take precedence over structured logging.
discussion_comments.comment_body: Thanks, @quaff. I wonder if people might miss this? They could read the paragraph above and then stop, happy that they know which configuration property to set. I think it might be more noticeable if we changed the paragraph above instead to start with something like "To enable structured logging, ensure that you aren't using custom log configuration and set the propertyâ€¦". WDYT?

@@ -450,6 +450,7 @@ Spring Boot supports structured logging and has support for the following JSON f
 
 To enable structured logging, set the property configprop:logging.structured.format.console[] (for console output) or configprop:logging.structured.format.file[] (for file output) to the id of the format you want to use.
 
+WARNING: xref:#features.logging.custom-log-configuration[Custom Log Configuration] take precedence over structured logging.
discussion_comments.comment_body: Actually, "Structured Logging" and "Custom Log Configuration" are not mutually exclusive, I updated the document. @wilkinsona

commented_code:
To enable structured logging, set the property configprop:logging.structured.format.console[] (for console output) or configprop:logging.structured.format.file[] (for file output) to the id of the format you want to use.
 
+If you are using xref:#features.logging.custom-log-configuration[Custom Log Configuration], update your configuration to respect `CONSOLE_LOG_STRUCTURED_FORMAT` and `FILE_LOG_STRUCTURED_FORMAT` system properties.
+Take `CONSOLE_LOG_STRUCTURED_FORMAT` for example:
+[tabs]
+======
+Logback::
++
+[source,xml]
+----
+<!-- replace your encoder with StructuredLogEncoder -->
+<encoder class="org.springframework.boot.logging.logback.StructuredLogEncoder">
+	<format>${CONSOLE_LOG_STRUCTURED_FORMAT}</format>
+	<charset>${CONSOLE_LOG_CHARSET}</charset>
+</encoder>
+----
+Log4j2::
++
+[source,xml]
+----
+<!-- wrap your PatternLayout with <Select> and <DefaultArbiter> -->
+<Select>

discussion_comments.commented_code:
@@ -450,6 +450,35 @@ Spring Boot supports structured logging and has support for the following JSON f
 
 To enable structured logging, set the property configprop:logging.structured.format.console[] (for console output) or configprop:logging.structured.format.file[] (for file output) to the id of the format you want to use.
 
+If you are using xref:#features.logging.custom-log-configuration[Custom Log Configuration], update your configuration to respect `CONSOLE_LOG_STRUCTURED_FORMAT` and `FILE_LOG_STRUCTURED_FORMAT` system properties.
+Take `CONSOLE_LOG_STRUCTURED_FORMAT` for example:

discussion_comments.comment_body: I think we can skip the whole select and arbiter stuff here. The user wants to have structured logging, no need for conditionals. The logback section isn't conditional, too.

discussion_comments.comment_body: I agree with @mhalbritter. We shouldn't over-complicate the documentation by showing the use of conditionals if they aren't always needed.
